transcription.text:
In their space puzzle game Heavenly Bodies, 2pt Interactive’s attention to colour, texture and shape softens the alien machinery of space. Inspired by the work of Soviet space architect Galina Balashova, the interiors of Heavenly Bodies feel inviting – colour-coding creates a sense of orientation, and the illusion of a roof and floor, despite the zero-gravity environment.
Unlike many puzzle games, the solution to every puzzle in Heavenly Bodies is meticulously laid out in diagrams provided by mission control, which are available in a beautifully rendered manual. The challenge comes from learning how to negotiate the finely tuned mechanics that control the cosmonauts as they navigate the warm, analogue interiors of the 70s-inspired spacecraft.
